articles.headline: Two Cities, Two Armies: Pivot Points in the Fight in Ukraine’s East
articles.snippet: The battle for the critical Donbas region in Ukraine is centered on two strategically important cities: Lyman, held by the Russians, and Bakhmut, held by Ukraine. The fighting over the cities is fierce as both armies race to claim new ground.
articles.abstract: The battle for the critical Donbas region in Ukraine is centered on two strategically important cities: Lyman, held by the Russians, and Bakhmut, held by Ukraine. The fighting over the cities is fierce as both armies race to claim new ground.
articles.lead_paragraph: DONETSK REGION, Ukraine — The Ukrainian soldier walked to the edge of the river, looked toward the sound of artillery in the distance and cast his fishing rod toward the murky green water below. His nonchalance on Ukraine’s front line close to the eastern city of Lyman was telling: His comrades nearby were winning.
articles.byline: By Thomas Gibbons-Neff, Natalia Yermak and Tyler Hicks

articles.headline: G.O.P. Redoubles Efforts to Tie Democrats to High Crime Rates
articles.snippet: With images of lawlessness, G.O.P. candidates are pressing the issue in places where worries about public safety are omnipresent. Democrats, on the defensive, are promising to fund the police.
articles.abstract: With images of lawlessness, G.O.P. candidates are pressing the issue in places where worries about public safety are omnipresent. Democrats, on the defensive, are promising to fund the police.
articles.lead_paragraph: In Pennsylvania, Republicans are attacking John Fetterman, the Democratic Senate candidate, as “dangerously liberal on crime.”
articles.byline: By Lisa Lerer and Jonathan Weisman

articles.headline: White House Student Loan Forgiveness Could Cost About $400 Billion
articles.snippet: The estimate by the nonpartisan Congressional Budget Office gauged the cost over 30 years, though the bulk of the effects to the economy would be felt over the next decade.
articles.abstract: The estimate by the nonpartisan Congressional Budget Office gauged the cost over 30 years, though the bulk of the effects to the economy would be felt over the next decade.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Biden’s plan to erase significant amounts of student loan debt for tens of millions of Americans could cost about $400 billion, the nonpartisan Congressional Budget Office said in a report Monday, making it one of the costliest programs in the president’s agenda.
articles.byline: By Katie Rogers and Jim Tankersley

articles.headline: Women Take Center Stage in Antigovernment Protests Shaking Iran
articles.snippet: Women have been casting off their legally required head scarves, forming the primary image of the protests. But grievances against a repressive regime go far beyond the hijab.
articles.abstract: Women have been casting off their legally required head scarves, forming the primary image of the protests. But grievances against a repressive regime go far beyond the hijab.
articles.lead_paragraph: For Yasi, the news felt too close to ignore: A young woman, Mahsa Amini, had died in the custody of Iran’s morality police, days after being arrested for failing to cover her hair modestly enough.
articles.byline: By Vivian Yee and Farnaz Fassihi

articles.headline: An Israel-Lebanon Border Deal Could Increase Natural Gas Supplies
articles.snippet: Offshore gas fields in the Mediterranean could become one of several new energy sources for European countries as they seek independence from Russia.
articles.abstract: Offshore gas fields in the Mediterranean could become one of several new energy sources for European countries as they seek independence from Russia.
articles.lead_paragraph: Israel and Lebanon have technically been at war since 1948, but the countries are close to an agreement that could increase production of natural gas, helping energy-starved Europe.

articles.headline: Inflation Has Hit Tenants Hard. What About Their Landlords?
articles.snippet: Publicly traded corporate landlords are reporting some of their highest margins ever, while smaller operators say rent increases are eaten up by costs.
articles.abstract: Publicly traded corporate landlords are reporting some of their highest margins ever, while smaller operators say rent increases are eaten up by costs.
articles.lead_paragraph: Of all the categories driving inflation in recent months, among the largest — and most persistent — is rent.

articles.headline: Biden Is Hoping Small Changes Go a Long Way on Immigration
articles.snippet: The United States has started to allow people to apply for asylum under a new process that the secretary of homeland security hopes can help fix the current “very broken system.”
articles.abstract: The United States has started to allow people to apply for asylum under a new process that the secretary of homeland security hopes can help fix the current “very broken system.”
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Even before the political spectacle of a Republican governor flying migrants to a tiny resort island in Massachusetts, President Biden’s top border officials decided there had to be a better asylum system in America.
articles.byline: By Michael D. Shear and Miriam Jordan
